titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the California Menus Collection M2125
titlestmt.author: Franz Kunst

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-05-09 10:44:54 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Collection of menus from California, especially San Francisco and Los Angeles.
did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36 hours in advance.
did.langmaterial: Most menus are in English, but a few are in French (or an appoximation of it), and the Chinese menus have sections in Chinese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of menus from events and restaurants from California, with a few from other states and countries. In all, more than 120 items ranging from 1866 to the 1980s, with most from the early-to-mid 20th century. More than half of the menus have specific dates. Arrangement is approximately geographical from north to south, with series for San Francisco, Los Angeles and the Bohemian Club among others. All items are menus unless otherwise stated; there are also a few advertisements, invitations, and postcards, as well as a set of nametags and a placemat. Condition is generally fair. Many have holes from scrapbook removal as well as rusty paperclip stains. Some silk and other bindings are untied, missing, or disintegrating.

Highlights include banquet menus from early visits by sitting U.S. Presidents to California, pre-1900 event menus on silk, menus from the 1929 Kyoto Conference, the Panama-California Exposition and Panama-Pacific International Exposition, Disney & 20th Century Fox-related menus from Southern California, and menus from both early and iconic restaurants in SF & LA.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased by Stanford University, Special Collections in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], California Menu Collection (M2125). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The California Historical Society holds a California Menu Collection (http://www.oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/c8qn68hw). The Los Angeles Public Library also has a menu collection (http://www.lapl.org/collections-resources/visual-collections/menu-collection).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Menus for the Palace and St. Francis Hotel are grouped first, followed by three Chinatown menus. The remainder of this series has been arranged chronologically, beginning with undated menus.

did.unittitle: California Commandery (Military Order, Loyal Legion, United States) Year-End Banquet, Hotel St. Francis
The Mural Room, St. Francis Hotel
Banquet Tendered to Benjamin Harrison, President of the United States By The Citizens of San Francisco. Palace Hotel
Ohio Society of California Banquet Tendered to President William McKinley At The Palace Hotel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies, one annotated. The banquet was cancelled due to Mrs. McKinley's illness.

did.unittitle: Palace Hotel, Christmas [hand painted Chinese-themed cover by LeLong]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With place cards and letter concerning the waiters for the head table.

did.unittitle: Blum's Fountain and Ice Cream Suggestions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dodge Brothers was a stationer & engraver located at 225 Post Street; this menu (for a special event, presumably) lists Ernst H. Ludwig as caterer.
